The two outputs should be the same except that the rk4 will group the same-ordered derivatives in [].
The problem is arrising in the addition going on in rk4 > k_mat(), specifically the line:
	temp_s[m][n] = state[m][n]+dh_mat[m][n]
This seems pretty straightforward, and appears to be doing the same thing that rk4_two_bodies.k()
is doing. 

Update: copying the derivative expressions (a1,a2 analytical expr.) from 1-03 to 1-04, and verifying
by eye the other contents of derivs() in each, proved that the issue emphatically is NOT related to 
derivative expressions.

rk4_two_bodies

state[1][1], dh[1][1]:  0 0 g
state[1][1], dh[1][1]:  0 -0.07570500000000002 g
state[1][1], dh[1][1]:  0 -0.0756038571914514 b: both
state[1][1], dh[1][1]:  0 -0.15120825437611907

state[1][1], v2:  0 0
state[1][1], v2:  0 0
state[1][1], v2:  0 0
state[1][1], v2:  0 0
